alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 29 at 2:27PM MST until June 29 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 226 PM MST, doppler radar indicated the potential for a wall of dust along a line extending from Estrella Mountain Park to Phoenix International Raceway to near Laveen to near South Mountain Park to 7 miles southwest of South Phoenix, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 127 and 153. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 204. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 2. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Glendale, Avondale, Goodyear, Tolleson, Laveen, Cashion, Glendale Sports Complex, South Phoenix, Arizona State Fairgrounds, South Mountain Park, Phoenix International Raceway, Downtown Phoenix, Sky Harbor Airport and Estrella Mountain Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
